Articles.Content:
Hello, I have looked around a bit and have not found anything about this topic, which is why I am asking this question:

Why are all of my aircraft slowly rolling to the right during flight? This issue begins at takeoff and persists until landing. This occurs in stock craft as well as those that I create, and I have also noticed this bug in stock 1.0.4.

What could be causing this and how could it be fixed?

-Carlpilot

Hi carlpilot, you most likely need more rudder.

Please upload the pics of the craft to imgur and the craft files to a file site like dropbox for us to check out
Also make sure you don't have a controller or joystick plugged in that could be giving off control input without you noticing

Here is one of the craft that the issue is at its worst on (the issue occurs in SAS-stabilised, level flight too)

Most people should have the .craft, it is 1.0.5's stock Velociteze.

My joystick is well within its dead zone when the issue occurs.

Please retest with the joystick unplugged, it's the only way to ensure it is not contributing to this issue.

Edited November 9, 2015 by sal_vager
Alright. Even with the joystick unplugged, the issue persists.
It's solid for me with no joystick and with SAS on, with SAS off you will have small floating point errors creeping in over time, this is not new and is why we have SAS (and trim too)
